body.p: A sample framework uses a Browser Form control to load an HTML. This HTML shows the coordinates using Google Maps and allows you to and edit the attributes underneath.

div.h2: How to test it, after install

ol.li: Open the file form-controls/travel-guide/travel-guide.xml from Oxygen's samples directory.
Scroll to the Points of Interest section.
Each point of interest has an address. Next to each address there is an action. Click the action.
A form control will appear and will present a marker on the map. Using right click you can move the marker and the address text and attributes will be updated automatically.

div.p: Everything is based on the Browser Form control that loads map.html:
The HTML loaded by this form control uses Google Maps to presents the coordinates:
The interaction between the Javascript and the Oxygen Workspace is possible through a number global variables visible in Javascript:

ul.li: authorAccess- this object is an instance of an ro.sync.ecss.extensions.api.AuthorAccess.
contextElement - an instance of an ro.sync.ecss.extensions.api.node.AuthorNode. The form control is added over this node.
fcArguments - a java.util.Map implementation tith the property name - property value pairs put on the form control function.
apiHelper - A helper object for creating Java objects. These objects can afterwards be passed as arguments when calling Oxygen's Java API.

div.p: Please see map.html for the full version.
